Major_Arcs.title: Paul Bunyan's Circus Adventure
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc follows Paul Bunyan's time at the circus, his confrontation with Matto Grasso, and the resolution of conflicts within the circus setting.

sub_scenes.title: Circus Arrival and Initial Encounters
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces Paul Bunyan as a circus performer and the arrival of the circus in town, showing the public's initial reactions and wonder.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival at the Circus and Giraffe Encounter

sub_scenes.title: Conflict with Billings and Matto Grasso
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene details the checkered shirt man's investigation of trouble, leading to confrontations with Billings and Matto Grasso, initiating physical conflict.

narrative_arcs.title: Investigating Sounds of Trouble and Encountering Billings
Confrontation and Attack by Matto Grasso
Overpowering Matto Grasso and Immediate Aftermath

sub_scenes.title: Recruitment and Revenge of Matto Grasso
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene covers the owner's encounter with the checkered shirt man (Paul Bunyan), his recruitment as the new strongman, and Matto Grasso's subsequent revenge plot.

narrative_arcs.title: Owner's Exposition on Matto Grasso's Threats
Introduction of Paul Bunyan and Matto Grasso's Revenge Plot
The Fire and Paul Bunyan's Resolution

sub_scenes.title: Ape Chaos and The Chase
sub_scenes.description: Matto Grasso's second revenge attempt involving releasing an ape, leading to Paul Bunyan's intervention and a chase through the circus.

narrative_arcs.title: Matto Grasso's Lingering Frustration and New Scheme
The Ape's Release and Paul Bunyan's Intervention
The Chase Begins: Paul Bunyan Pursues Matto Grasso

sub_scenes.title: Final Confrontation and Departure
sub_scenes.description: The final confrontation between Paul Bunyan and Matto Grasso, leading to Grasso's capture, a job offer for Bunyan, and his decision to return to the North Woods.

Major_Arcs.title: Marco Polo's Eastern Quests
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc details two distinct adventures of Marco Polo in the East: his encounter with the Ogress of Tibet and his rescue of Princess Lotus in Hi-Town.

sub_scenes.title: Tibetan Ogress Encounter
sub_scenes.description: Marco Polo's perilous journey to Tibet and his initial encounter hinting at the Awful Ogress.

sub_scenes.title: Rescue and Journey to Hi-Town
sub_scenes.description: Marco Polo's rescue of a bound man, receiving a sacred dagger, and his journey towards Hi-Town.

sub_scenes.title: Princess Lotus and the Witch's Castle Deception
sub_scenes.description: Marco Polo learns about the missing Princess Lotus, offers help, and gets deceived by the beggar woman leading him to the Ogress's castle.

narrative_arcs.title: Meeting the King and the Missing Princess
Entering the Mysterious Castle and Revealing the 'Children'
Transformation and Confrontation with the Ogress
Impending Battle with Mice and Claws

sub_scenes.title: Ogress's Defeat and Royal Farewell
sub_scenes.description: Marco Polo's capture and escape from the Ogress, rescue of Princess Lotus, and his departure from Hi-Town.

narrative_arcs.title: Attack, Escape Attempt and Capture by Snakes
Further Restraint and Threat of Revenge
The Surprise Attack and Ogress's Defeat

Major_Arcs.title: The Treasure Keeper's Tale of Betrayal
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc narrates a tragic tale of treasure, betrayal, and revenge centered around Captain Brooking, Officer Jordan, and a hidden treasure in India.

sub_scenes.title: Prologue and Penal Colony Setup
sub_scenes.description: The Treasure Keeper introduces the tale, setting a dark tone, followed by the introduction of the British penal colony setting and characters.

sub_scenes.title: The Treasure Deal and Betrayal
sub_scenes.description: A prisoner reveals the treasure to Captain Brooking, leading to a deal for escape and the Captain's ultimate betrayal.

narrative_arcs.title: Realization of Betrayal and Captain's Escape

sub_scenes.title: Revenge and Fatal Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: Jordan's pursuit of Captain Brooking to England, their confrontation, and the tragic climax in the attic.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival at Brooking's Home: A Luxurious Trap
Ascent to the Attic and Treasure Reveal

Major_Arcs.title: Dr. Styx and the Haunted Matthews Estate
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc follows Dr. Styx's involvement in the haunted Matthews estate, revealing a tale of murder, ghostly unrest, and ultimate resolution through forgiveness and love.

sub_scenes.title: Initial Investigation and Courtroom Drama
sub_scenes.description: Introduction of Dr. Styx in a confrontational scene and a parallel courtroom drama setting up the context of the Matthews murder case.

sub_scenes.title: The Haunted Estate and Northrup's Arrival
sub_scenes.description: Introduction of Henry Northrup, the haunted Matthews estate, and his arrival to investigate the supernatural disturbances.

narrative_arcs.title: The White Elephant Estate and Unsavory Events
Arrival at the Haunted Matthews Estate
Ignoring the Warning and Entering the Haunted House
The Sinister Voice of Vincent Matthews

sub_scenes.title: Resolution through Forgiveness and Love
sub_scenes.description: The resolution of the haunting through a dialogue focusing on fear, forgiveness, and brotherly love, culminating in Vincent and Rosalind's reconciliation and departure.

narrative_arcs.title: Admission of Fear and Seeking Salvation
The Condition for Rest and the Forgiver's Identity
Resistance and Compulsion to Confront Rosalind
Identification and Introduction of the Accused
The Troubled House and the Drive to Town

Major_Arcs.title: Henry Hudson's Arctic Voyages
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc chronicles Henry Hudson's voyages to find the Northwest Passage, his initial unsuccessful journey, and the tragic second voyage ending in mutiny and his banishment.

sub_scenes.title: Historical Setup and First Voyage Commission
sub_scenes.description: Historical introduction to Henry Hudson's fate and the Dutch East India Company's proposition for his first voyage.

narrative_arcs.title: Historical Context of Henry Hudson's Fate
The Dutch East India Company's Proposition
Threat of Mutiny and Turning South
Entering the Hudson River with Hope
False Alarm and Realization of Dead End
Hudson's Reflection and Decision to Return Home

sub_scenes.title: Second Voyage and Mutiny
sub_scenes.description: Hudson's second voyage, leading to icy conditions, crew discontent, and ultimately a mutiny resulting in his banishment.

narrative_arcs.title: Extreme Northerly Route and Icy Predicament
The Ice Melts and Voyage Recommences
Mutiny and Captain's Assertion of Authority
Return of the Mutineers and Grim News

Major_Arcs.title: The Arabian Knight and the Tartar Threat
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc tells the story of Hassan, the Arabian Knight, and his quest to rescue a kidnapped woman from the Tartar horsemen led by Kurgan, culminating in a trial by combat and a romantic reward.

sub_scenes.title: Mission Briefing and Pursuit
sub_scenes.description: Introduction of Hassan and the Tartar threat, his summoning by the Caliph, and the initiation of his pursuit to rescue the kidnapped daughter.

narrative_arcs.title: Introduction of the Arabian Knight and the Tartar Threat
Summoned by the Caliph and the Rescue Mission
Journey to the Oasis and Discovery of Tracks
Following the Trail of the Tartars
Encounter and Warning from a Traveler

sub_scenes.title: Infiltration and Capture in Tartar Camp
sub_scenes.description: Hassan's infiltration of the Tartar camp, his search for the kidnapped woman, and his eventual discovery and capture.

narrative_arcs.title: Inside the Tartar Camp - The Search Begins
Reaching the Prisoner and Making Contact

sub_scenes.title: Trial by Combat and Romantic Resolution
sub_scenes.description: Hassan's interrogation by Kurgan, the trial by combat, his unlikely victory, and the budding romance with the rescued woman.

narrative_arcs.title: The Signal and the Unfair Fight Begins
Dirt in the Eyes and Immediate Attack
